three_act.name: Three-Act Structure
three_act.description: The classic storytelling model divided into Setup, Confrontation, and Resolution.

acts.label: Act I – Setup
acts.description: Introduce main character, setting, and inciting incident.

acts.label: Act II – Conflict
acts.description: Rising conflict, midpoint reversal, growing stakes.

acts.label: Act III – Resolution
acts.description: Climax, resolution, and character transformation.

save_the_cat.name: Save the Cat
save_the_cat.description: A screenwriting-focused model that uses 15 specific beats to guide structure.

acts.label: Opening Image
acts.description: A visual snapshot that represents the story's theme and tone.

acts.label: Theme Stated
acts.description: The story's central message is hinted at or directly stated.

acts.label: Set-Up
acts.description: Establish the protagonist's world, relationships, and status quo.

acts.label: Catalyst
acts.description: The inciting incident that sets the story in motion.

acts.label: Debate
acts.description: The protagonist hesitates and considers their options.

acts.label: Break into Two
acts.description: The protagonist commits to the adventure and enters Act II.

acts.label: B Story
acts.description: A subplot that reinforces the theme, often involving relationships.

acts.label: Fun and Games
acts.description: The promise of the premise is delivered; the most entertaining part.

acts.label: Midpoint
acts.description: A major plot point that raises the stakes and changes direction.

acts.label: Bad Guys Close In
acts.description: Opposition forces gather strength; things get worse for the protagonist.

acts.label: All is Lost
acts.description: The protagonist's lowest point; defeat seems inevitable.

acts.label: Dark Night of the Soul
acts.description: A moment of reflection and despair before the final push.

acts.label: Break into Three
acts.description: The protagonist finds new resolve and enters the final act.

acts.label: Finale
acts.description: The climactic confrontation and resolution of all storylines.

acts.label: Final Image
acts.description: A visual that contrasts with the opening image, showing change.

heros_journey.name: Hero's Journey
heros_journey.description: Mythic structure popularized by Joseph Campbell. Follows a cyclical adventure arc.

acts.label: Ordinary World
acts.description: The hero's normal life before transformation begins.

acts.label: Call to Adventure
acts.description: The hero is presented with a problem or challenge.

acts.label: Refusal of the Call
acts.description: The hero hesitates or refuses the adventure due to fear or duty.

acts.label: Meeting the Mentor
acts.description: The hero encounters a wise figure who provides advice or magical gifts.

acts.label: Crossing the Threshold
acts.description: The hero commits to the adventure and enters the special world.

acts.label: Tests, Allies, Enemies
acts.description: The hero faces challenges and makes allies and enemies.

acts.label: Approach to the Inmost Cave
acts.description: The hero prepares for the major challenge in the special world.

acts.label: Ordeal
acts.description: The hero faces their greatest fear or most difficult challenge.

acts.label: Reward
acts.description: The hero survives and gains something from the dangerous experience.

acts.label: The Road Back
acts.description: The hero begins the journey back to the ordinary world.

acts.label: Resurrection
acts.description: The hero faces a final test and is transformed by the experience.

acts.label: Return with the Elixir
acts.description: The hero returns home transformed and able to benefit others.

story_circle.name: Dan Harmon's Story Circle
story_circle.description: A simplified character-driven model with 8 steps of transformation.

acts.label: Comfort Zone
acts.description: A character is in a zone of comfort.

acts.label: Want Something
acts.description: But they want something.

acts.label: Unfamiliar Situation
acts.description: They enter an unfamiliar situation.

acts.label: Adapt
acts.description: Adapt to it.

acts.label: Get What They Wanted
acts.description: Get what they wanted.

acts.label: Pay Heavy Price
acts.description: Pay a heavy price.

acts.label: Return to Familiar
acts.description: Return to their familiar situation.

acts.label: Having Changed
acts.description: Having changed.

freytags_pyramid.name: Freytag's Pyramid
freytags_pyramid.description: A dramatic structure focusing on the arc of tension and conflict.

acts.label: Exposition
acts.description: Introduction of characters, setting, and background information.

acts.label: Rising Action
acts.description: Series of events that build tension and develop the conflict.

acts.label: Climax
acts.description: The turning point and most intense moment of the story.

acts.label: Falling Action
acts.description: Events that happen after the climax and lead toward resolution.

acts.label: Denouement
acts.description: The resolution where conflicts are resolved and loose ends tied up.

kishotenketsu.name: Kishōtenketsu
kishotenketsu.description: A four-part structure common in Japanese storytelling, emphasizing contrast and resolution.

acts.label: Ki (Introduction)
acts.description: Introduces the characters, setting, and initial situation.

acts.label: Shō (Development)
acts.description: Develops the situation and characters without major conflict.

acts.label: Ten (Twist)
acts.description: Introduces an unexpected element that changes perspective.

acts.label: Ketsu (Conclusion)
acts.description: Resolves the story by tying together all elements.

mckee_structure.name: Robert McKee's Structure
mckee_structure.description: Focuses on the importance of conflict and character arcs in storytelling.

acts.label: Inciting Incident
acts.description: The event that sets the story in motion and disrupts the protagonist's life.

acts.label: Progressive Complications
acts.description: A series of increasingly difficult obstacles and conflicts.

acts.label: Crisis
acts.description: The moment of greatest pressure when a crucial decision must be made.

acts.label: Climax
acts.description: The protagonist's action in response to the crisis.

acts.label: Resolution
acts.description: The outcome of the climactic action and story's conclusion.

pixar_structure.name: Pixar Story Structure
pixar_structure.description: Pixar's character-driven approach emphasizing emotional transformation and relatability.

acts.label: Once Upon a Time
acts.description: Establish the protagonist's world, personality, and what makes them relatable.

acts.label: Every Day
acts.description: Show the protagonist's routine and what their normal life looks like.

acts.label: Until One Day
acts.description: The inciting incident that disrupts the protagonist's normal world.

acts.label: Because of That
acts.description: The first consequence/reaction to the inciting incident.

acts.label: Because of That (continued)
acts.description: Chain of escalating consequences that build dramatic tension.

acts.label: Until Finally
acts.description: The climax where the protagonist faces their greatest challenge.

acts.label: Ever Since Then
acts.description: The resolution showing how the protagonist has changed.

acts.label: Moral/Theme
acts.description: The underlying message about growth, relationships, or life lessons.

seven_point_story.name: Seven-Point Story Structure
seven_point_story.description: Brandon Sanderson's structure focusing on character arcs and plot progression.

acts.label: Hook
acts.description: Opening scene that grabs attention and establishes tone.

acts.label: Plot Turn 1
acts.description: The inciting incident that gets the story moving.

acts.label: Pinch Point 1
acts.description: First major obstacle that shows the antagonist's power.

acts.label: Midpoint
acts.description: Major revelation or shift that changes everything.

acts.label: Pinch Point 2
acts.description: Second major obstacle that tests the protagonist.

acts.label: Plot Turn 2
acts.description: The protagonist gains what they need for the final confrontation.

acts.label: Resolution
acts.description: The climax and conclusion of the story.

fichtean_curve.name: Fichtean Curve
fichtean_curve.description: A structure emphasizing multiple rising crises rather than a single climax.

acts.label: Initial Incident
acts.description: The story begins with action or conflict rather than exposition.

acts.label: Rising Action - Crisis 1
acts.description: First major crisis that escalates the conflict.

acts.label: Rising Action - Crisis 2
acts.description: Second crisis that further complicates the situation.

acts.label: Rising Action - Crisis 3
acts.description: Third crisis that brings tension to near-breaking point.

acts.label: Climax
acts.description: The final, most intense crisis and turning point.

acts.label: Falling Action
acts.description: Brief resolution of the climactic crisis.

acts.label: Denouement
acts.description: Final resolution and return to stability.

in_media_res.name: In Media Res
in_media_res.description: Starting in the middle of action, then revealing background through flashbacks.

acts.label: Opening Action
acts.description: Begin in the middle of intense action or conflict.

acts.label: Backstory Reveal
acts.description: Reveal background information through flashbacks or exposition.

acts.label: Present Continuation
acts.description: Return to and continue the opening action.

acts.label: Escalation
acts.description: Build tension beyond the opening conflict.

acts.label: Climax
acts.description: The story reaches its peak intensity.

acts.label: Resolution
acts.description: Conclude the story and resolve all conflicts.

nested_loops.name: Nested Loops
nested_loops.description: Multiple interconnected storylines that weave together and resolve.

acts.label: Establish Loop A
acts.description: Introduce the first storyline and its central conflict.

acts.label: Establish Loop B
acts.description: Introduce the second storyline and its connection to Loop A.

acts.label: Establish Loop C
acts.description: Introduce additional storylines that interconnect.

acts.label: Develop Connections
acts.description: Show how the different storylines influence each other.

acts.label: Convergence
acts.description: The storylines come together in unexpected ways.

acts.label: Resolve Inner Loops
acts.description: Resolve secondary storylines first.

acts.label: Resolve Outer Loop
acts.description: Resolve the main storyline that encompasses all others.

sequence_approach.name: Sequence Approach
sequence_approach.description: Hollywood's 8-sequence structure treating feature films as eight mini-movies.

acts.label: Sequence 1 - Setup
acts.description: Establish character, world, and tone. End with inciting incident.

acts.label: Sequence 2 - Predicament
acts.description: Character reacts to inciting incident and formulates a plan.

acts.label: Sequence 3 - First Obstacle
acts.description: Initial attempt to solve the problem faces major resistance.

acts.label: Sequence 4 - First Culmination
acts.description: Midpoint sequence where stakes are raised and direction shifts.

acts.label: Sequence 5 - Subplot/Obstacles
acts.description: Character faces new complications, often involving relationships.

acts.label: Sequence 6 - Main Culmination
acts.description: Major setback that seems to end all hope of success.

acts.label: Sequence 7 - Final Push
acts.description: Character finds inner strength and makes final attempt.

acts.label: Sequence 8 - Resolution
acts.description: Climax and resolution of all story threads.

story_diamond.name: Story Diamond
story_diamond.description: Character-focused alternative to Hero's Journey emphasizing internal transformation.

acts.label: Character in Comfort
acts.description: Protagonist in their familiar world, but with underlying dissatisfaction.

acts.label: Call to Discomfort
acts.description: Something challenges the character's comfort zone.

acts.label: Growing Discomfort
acts.description: Character faces increasing challenges that test their beliefs.

acts.label: Moment of Truth
acts.description: Peak discomfort where character must choose change or remain the same.

acts.label: Commitment to Change
acts.description: Character decides to transform and takes decisive action.

acts.label: Experimenting with Change
acts.description: Character tries new behaviors and ways of being.

acts.label: Final Test
acts.description: Character's transformation is tested in a crucial moment.

acts.label: New Comfort
acts.description: Character reaches a new equilibrium, fundamentally changed.
